body:
> produces these changes for every created migration

correct, you need to execute created migration before generating a new one. Migration generator checks your entities and your database, finds difference and writes into the file.
can you create a minimal reproduction git repo (with clear steps of execution)?

Here you go, for both this issue and #1686

https://github.com/asvetliakov/typeorm-bugs

I've run into this recently for a column of type 'double' and wanted to try to provide some additional information in the hope it helps.

My setup is mysql 5.6 (testing against a docker container), mysql2 driver, TypeORM 0.2.9.

I uncommented the logging here:
https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/blob/a1ead76c89f4b4940424038c2a11f629320a4114/src/driver/mysql/MysqlDriver.ts#L613

And observed:
```
precision: 22 undefined
```
for
```
            console.log("precision:", tableColumn.precision, columnMetadata.precision);
```

Which makes sense as no precision was specified in the entity definition.  In the case where nothing is specified, should no change be assumed?  E.g. (only affected line shown)
```javascript

                || columnMetadata.precision && tableColumn.precision !== columnMetadata.precision

```
Should that seem like a reasonable default I'm happy to work up a PR to that effect.

issue.title: TypeORM migration:generate produces pointless migration changes

repository.name: typeorm
repository.description: ORM for TypeScript and JavaScript. Supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, SQLite, MS SQL Server, Oracle, SAP Hana, WebSQL databases. Works in NodeJS, Browser, Ionic, Cordova and Electron platforms.

issue.title: @Column which type is 'datetime' will be altered everytime when server restart

everytime i restart my app, the sql bellow will excute again
```sql
ALTER TABLE `qc_concern_company` CHANGE `concern_time` `concern_time` datetime NULL
```
the column define in typeorm
```ts

```

body: Problem still occurs in PostgreSQL `datetime` field nullability change
it's 2021 and this's still happening with mariadb, anyone got a solution? :(

As there was a PR that had tests that confirmed this specific case resolved please open a new issue with information on how to reproduce the problem if you believe something similar is happening again.
